text: hi everyone its Ellen here today I will
be making tea a hormone or taro pudding
this is a very delicious dessert that I
had a chance to try during my last trip
to Hawaii so I was in here the other day
it's a beautiful city located in the
center of Vietnam is where you can find
the famous noodle soup Boombah way right
on the street before 1945 where was the
national capital of Vietnam under the
moon dynasty this unique city in not
only rich in history culture
architecture but also in cuisine is also
famous in offering many kinds of sweet
soup oh yay I ran into the street side
food cards on the pavement of one of the
main streets in hurry they offer 20
different kinds of chair over here
including Royal Suite soups or jakkuman
and also common ones for normal folks
yeah it's also a part of high culture
many people especially the teenagers and
workers they gather to eat the streets
with soup as a refreshing reward after
finishing a hard working day
there are so many kinds of chair over
here that if you have to try several
times a day you have to stay here for a
week to enjoy all of Jared J normally
serves in small bowls glasses or a
transparent plastic bags for takeaway
today I will cook one of them which is
Giacomo or taro pudding now let's learn
how to make it let's begin
recipes the ingredients are super simple
you only need taro which should be cut
into about 1 inch cubes like this
glutinous or a sticky rice sugar and
pandan extract today I use Vietnamese
sticky rice which has shorter and
rounder grains
it's normally more sticky than the Thai
sticky rice of course you can use any
other kinds of sticky rice that you have
washed three times until the water runs
clear and then soak in water for at
least one hour add some water in the
large pot place the steamer basket into
it and steam the Tarot's for about 10 to
15 minutes until they are soft enough
that you can pull through with a
chopstick or a fork you can also place
the Taro's in a bowl cover and microwave
for about 5 minutes is faster and easier
that way then bring another saucepan of
1 liter or 4 cups of water to a boil and
then add the glutinous rice the rice
should be soaked in water for at least 1
hour or better overnight to speed up the
cooking process give it a good stir and
bring to a boil again then lower the
heat to medium and cook for about 5
minutes occasionally stirring so that
the rice won't stick to the bottom of
the pot at the bottom for five minutes
just cover the pot and turn off the heat
just leave it there for one to two hours
when you come back in an hour the right
has softened and expanded a lot bring it
to a boil again and simmer on low heat
for another five to ten minutes
this method of cooking saves a lot of
energy and also prevent burning the rice
then add in the steamed taro stir well
and cook for another five minutes the
rice grain should be blooming but not
turns mushy so don't over stir to give
the sweet soup a nice color and
fragrance add a few drops of Panda
extract you can buy depending extract at
Asian store you can also make it at home
yourself just click on the pictures to
know how then add 3/4 cups of sugar this
is enough sugar for my taste but of
course you can increase or decrease the
amount of sugar and to your preference
stir well and simmer on low heat for
about 15 minutes so the sugar is well
incorporated into the pudding to my turn
the taste of sugar for any chair you
need to add about quarter teaspoon of
salt and some vanilla if you like in
Vietnam they sell vanilla in these tiny
cute tubes you can sell the pudding hot
or chilled with some coconut sauce on
top the taro should be soft and creamy
the pudding tastes so great with the
coconut sauce and a hint of painting and
vanilla
mmm super yummy and you know where arrow
is even more yummy all the amazing food
that you cooked to photo and uploaded on
Instagram Facebook and Google+ with
hashtag helen recipes thank you so much
for sending in your photos
